IT.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: cirrhotic (max Child-Pugh B) patients with unresectable M0 multi-nodular HCC, in the absence of portal thrombosis

NL.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PO.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: patients with non-surgical hepatocellular carcinoma in good general condition and with good liver function (Child and Pugha Class A)
patients previously treated with Sorafenib with AFP ≥ 400 ng/ ml
patients who are well tolerant of sorafenib
second-line patients who have previously received bevacizumab with atezolizumab

SE.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma with good functional status (WHO PS 0-1) with good liver function (Child Pugh A) without contraindications to the medicinal products
patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma with good functional status (WHO PS 0-1) with good liver function (Child Pugh A) when combination therapy is inappropriate

patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma with good functional status (WHO PS 0-1) with good liver function (Child Pugh A) who cannot be offered atezolizumab, bevacizumab or tremelimumab
